Self-isolation at own accommodation or approved site- subject to PCR. Travellers arriving at Bamako airport will be given a mandatory PCR test on arrival. You will be contacted within 72 hours if the results of this test are positive and will then be required to self-isolate for 14 days at your own expense.
Provided you have a negative COVID test less than 72 hours old, you are not required to quarantine on arrival. If you test positive whilst you are in Mali, you are expected to self-isolate for 14 days.

Latest News:

International Restrictions:
*Entry to Mali: To enter Mali you need to present a negative COVID test certificate less than 72 hours old. Provided you have a negative COVID test less than 72 hours old, you are not required to quarantine on arrival. If you test positive whilst you are in Mali, you are expected to self-isolate for 14 days. Entry requirements for Mali are the same for all travellers, regardless of COVID-19 vaccination status.
Children under 5 are not required to provide a negative Covid test on arrival at Bamako airport. You should check with your airline before travelling for the most up to date guidance.
*Transit: Transiting is when you pass through one country on the way to your final destination.

Internal Restrictions:
*Travel in Mali: On 9 January the Economic Community of West African States (ECOWAS) announced the closure of land and air borders between ECOWAS countries and Mali. Regional borders are closed.
*Accommodation: Hotels are open.
